bdy.p:
LogiXML, Inc. is a company that develops and sells Business Intelligence (BI) software to private and public enterprises worldwide. Based in McLean,
Virginia , USA, it is run by its founder and CEO, Arman Eshraghi and currently employs approximately 50 employees.

sec.p: LogiXML was founded in 2000 by Arman Eshraghi, a software development and architecture professional with a special interest in engines. The company's mission was to help software developers create and maintain data-centric Web applications.1

The first product developed by LogiXML was LGX AppDev (2000). This was an
XML -based engine that built Web applications, and it was soon geared to the specific task of report-building for BI. Although some companies still use LGX AppDev, the product is no longer offered.

In 2002, LogiXML created LGX Report, the first engine-driven, XML-based reporting application. Between 2002 and 2004, more features were added to LGX Report until Eshraghi made the decision to brand the full-featured version separately--as LGX Info--while offering the basic version for free.

Therefore, in 2004, LogiXML began marketing LGX Report as a free Web-based BI reporting tool; the product was more recently renamed Logi Report or Freereporting.com. Like the other applications offered by LogiXML, LGX Report was built on
XML technology.2

In 2006, LogiXML discontinued the LGX branding and introduced the Logi product line, consisting of applications for ad hoc, managed and OLAP reporting, an embedded database to be used between operational databases and reporting servers, plus a connector pack for integration of commonly-used Web-based sources into the Logi reporting environment.
LogiXML currently offers the following Web-based BI reporting and analysis products:

list.entry: Freereporting.com - A free managed reporting BI solution that includes tabular and cross-tab reports, charts and graphs and drill-down capability
Logi Info - A managed reporting product that includes dashboards, interactive analysis grid, data viewer and heat maps
Logi Ad Hoc - An ad hoc reporting product that includes report scheduling, interactive data viewer, tree and heat maps

Logi OLAP - An OLAP analysis tool

Logi Intelligence Server - A data-integration tool that optimizes data for reporting and analysis and offers other capabilities such as search function and historical data capture
Logi Connector Pack - A package that integrates data from some commonly used Web-based sources (such as Salesforce.com) and the Logi reporting environment
Logi ETL - A Web-based extract, transform and load ( ETL) tool that can be purchased along with other Logi products or as a standalone ETL
Logi 9 - A bundled platform including Logi Info, Logi Ad Hoc, Logi OLAP, Logi Intelligence Server and Logi ETL.
